dialogues.text: It was clear. It was just. It mattered. A NIGHTHAWK swoops across the Valley. Gliding low in sear of prey...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We must be the thing we are. Your gift wasn’t right for our gray, murky world. Your soul needed black and white. A clear reason. (beat) You’re an instrument of justice, Robert. You can’t run from that. Flame so low we can only see their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you knew this before you came here. Susan turns to look at McCall for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You didn’t come here for help. You came here for permission. McCall doesn’t move. Knows it’s true.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There were rumors about rogue CIA teams for years. Basically doing contract work for interests abroad. (beat) What you’re talking about is different. High level Field Agents on US soil. An arrangement with a Pushkin would make them extremely dangerous. Anyone perceived as a threat would be terminated. (sighs) Were I talking to anyone else my advice would be this: Minneapolis is wonderful this time of year. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) But I’m not. I’m talking to a force of nature. Susan lifts the Coleman and turns it off. For a brief mom we are immersed in the absence of the light. When our eye adjust, here, away from cities and the things of man, all seems right. The two stand framed against this wonder. We can’t see th anymore. We just HEAR...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All I can say is heaven help them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An upscale LOFT in SOHO. Teddy on a treadmill running hard. Has been for some time Massive chest heaving as he pushes himself to the limit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large shower already running. Teddy’s head under the steaming water. Letting the stream run over his face. Looks down and realizes the water is pooling at his feet. The drain is plugged. Bends down to open it... When lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: What the... Teddy slides opens the glass door and SEES...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Sitting on the closed toilet. Across the room from the shower. An electrical cord pulled from a lamp in his hand ends stripped bare. McCall stares at Teddy. A dark, hollow stare. Plugs the cord in. Teddy starting to step out of the shower when McCall toss the cord out like a fishing cast.  69. Hits the water at Teddy’s feet sending a SHOCK through hi body. Moving him back into the shower. McCall pulls the cord back.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Who are you? McCall stays quiet. Teddy tries to move again. McCall snaps out the cord - shocking him again. Teddy jumps back. Room filling with steam now... McCall’s image is getting faint. Ghost-like. Begins touching the two ends of the cord together. Lighti his face through the mist in brief hypnotic flashes. Teddy stays frozen in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t know who you're fucking with.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: I know exactly.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: If you did, this would be the last place you'd... McCall throws the cord again. Hits the water... this time leaves it a bit... SPARKS FLASH as Teddy trembles. The massive jolt surging through his body. McCall snaps the cord back. Teddy breathes heavy and braces himself against the walls the shower. McCall sparking the ends of the wire again. Steam getting thicker. McCall’s image fainter.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Special Agent Theodore Coleman. CIA, NCS Division. Counter Intelligence, 9 years. 41. Ex- Navy Seal. Your liver enzymes are high. History of primary mitral valve prolapse. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It rains you walk with a limp because of the MCL injury you suffered in Kuwait never healed properly. I’11 show you the x-rays if you want.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: You going to kill me, do it.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: I don’t need to kill you like this. I can think of over 20 ways to kill you right now... in this room alone.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: What do you want, McCall? McCall stares at Teddy through the dense steam... Almost disappearing. Tosses the cord out again and leaves it. Teddy trembles a the VOLTAGE COURSES THROUGH HIS BODY. Eyes bulge, hands g the sides of the shower... When it’s almost too much to bear... The cord snaps back. Teddy falls in the shower GASPING for breath. Room now filled with steam. Can’t see more than a few inches. Out the steam the cord ends spark like an orange beacon. TEDDY (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: I want us to be clear with one another. Teddy sees a wooden back brush. Grabs it and breaks the brush head off. Giving him a jagged sliver of wood. Tries to SEE McCall through the steam. Can’t. Just his VOICE...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (OS)
dialogues.text: I’m going to take you down. Piece by piece. And everyone that’s with you.  71.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: You think so...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: I’m already doing it. You just have to decide who you’re more afraid of... me or Pushkin. McCall SPARKS the ends together once more...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Either way you’re done. Teddy slides the glass door open a sliver...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be better all around if you turn yourself into IA. I’m offering you an out. I suggest you take it... Otherwise this will not end well for you... In ONE SWIFT MOTION Teddy throws the door open and JAMS T WOOD SLIVER INTO THE WALL OUTLET! POWER to the HOUSE GOES OUT... Teddy grabbing the GLOCK from under the towels and FIRING PORCELAIN AND TILE SHATTERING as SIX ROUNDS EVISCERATES t TOILET... Teddy moving naked through the steam and finding McCall g

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Flushed and angry. Out into the hall, Glock in his hand, loaded and ready. Slowly...

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Clears the house. Room to room. Nothing. Gets to the FOYE and SEES he FRONT DOOR wide open...

dialogues.speaker: EXERCISE AREA
dialogues.text: Teddy grabbing his CELL off of the treadmill and DIALING. Masters answers...  72.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: He was here!

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: McCall!

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: He’s in Mexico City. We just got confirma--

dialogues.speaker: HE WAS IN MY FUCKING HOUSE
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the BACK OF TEDDY’S PHONE. An almost invisible CLEAR PLASTIC STRIP with faint circuitry running through it...

dialogues.speaker: ON MCCALL
dialogues.text: On HIS phone. Ear piece in LISTENING TO...

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (0S)
dialogues.text: Get a hold of everybody. I want a meet in 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall being handed a bag of CHEAP EQUIPMENT...

dialogues.speaker: LEGAL PAD
dialogues.text: Pen scribbling the name MASTERS on it. Names PEDERSON and BUDDY already on the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with FAMILIES and TOURISTS on this incredibly BRIG afternoon. Sailboats in the Harbour. The Circle Line Ferr chugging past the Statue of Liberty. McCall on a picnic bench eating a salad. Pen and pad in front of him. HEADPHONES on. Head nodding in rhythm to wh appears to be MUSIC.  73. But really listening to...

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (OS)
dialogues.text: Pederson takes the whore’s apartment... Stabs a plastic fork in his SALAD and takes a bite. Cheap Radio Shack Sound Amplifier under the table. $49.00 and g up to 100 feet. Pointed at...

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Twenty yards away. Standing near the railing to the FERRY TERMINAL. Bodies tense and wound tight as steel tourniquets.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: What’s he want? I mean everybody wants something.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: He wants our heads. That’s all we need to know.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Writing the words Weak next to Buddy’s name.

dialogues.speaker: PIER PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Jammed with CARS and SUV's baking under a blazing sun. Including Teddy's. Under which McCall slaps a tiny GPS transmitter as he walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall sitting across from the store’s SUPERVISOR Georgie

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Just a couple of days until I can straighten it out.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIE
dialogues.text: Hey. Family comes first. Marcus can cover your shift until Monday.  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Masters inside. Parked down the block from McCall's Apartment Building. Eyes peeled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pederson passing the Check Cashing Place for the third ti McCall's bank/Credit card Statements on the passenger sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glass and steel monolith nestled in the 600 Block of Madison Avenue. No designation or name on the facade. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humming with SECURITY PERSONNEL. Everybody emptying pockets and checked by GUARDS before stepping through SOPHISTICATED BODY SCANNERS. Including Teddy and Buddy. Walking to the SECURE ELEVATOR where they wait in SILENCE. Teddy playing the game with McCall in his head. After a moment...

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Everybody cares about something...

dialogues.speaker: EAST 19TH STREET
dialogues.text: Rush hour TRAFFIC inches along. Staccato BURSTS of HORN a SQUEALING breaks. Buses heaving their hulks across lanes. Weaving her way through it all comes...

dialogues.speaker: TERI
dialogues.text: Stepping between PARKED CARS and onto the sidewalk. Luggi her book bag halfway up the block. Blissfully unaware of the TWO RUSSIAN MURDERERS sliding o of the Lincoln behind her.  75. Predatory faces watching her enter her Five Story walk-up

dialogues.speaker: THIRD FLOOR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Teri trudges the final flight. Walks to the last apartmen at the end of the hall. Unlocks the door and steps inside SOUNDS of the CHAIN and DEAD BOLT follow. A moment later the two Russians are on either side of Ter door. Pockets handgun heavy, assessing the locks. The LITTLE RUSSIAN pulls a set of tools... The SOUND of GLASS BREAKING comes from somewhere down the adjoining hallway. What happens next happens fast and like this: LARGE RUSSI (Mighty Joe Young with a brain) creeps along the wall to what’s what. Peers around the corner. The blow from the Fire Extinguis collapses the front of his head like a soda can. LITTLE RUSSIAN stunned for a split second. And that secon gets him deceased. McCall taking only one step and breaking his larynx befor his weapon clears his belt. The next thing WE SEE are their legs disappearing into th TRASH ROOM...

dialogues.speaker: BASEMENT
dialogues.text: TWO GUNS then BODIES tumbling from the trash chute and in the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical Field Agent’s space. File Boxes piled everywhere. Six year old computer tied to a secure line. Teddy at the window pondering the next move when his CELL RINGS. Recognizes the number and picks up.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Better be what I want to hear.  76.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (OS)
dialogues.text: Depends on what you were expecting. I suspect you’re a tad disappointed already. Teddy doesn’t move. You’d swear his pulse actually DROPS.

dialogues.speaker: COMMUNICATIONS ROOM
dialogues.text: SCREENS with CAMERA FEEDS from HOT AREAS in the City. SUB PLATFORMS, BRIDGES, TUNNELS etc. SEVERAL TACTICIANS wearing HEADSETS monitor WIRELESS COMMUNICATION. Teddy striding in. Slides the Mobile number in front of T 1. It’s quickly punched into the system which begins triangulating McCall’s number. ON THE SCREEN WE SEE the SIGNAL AREA shrinking rapidly...

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Gotta tell you I consider myself a smart guy. Still can’t figure this. Why you...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (OS)
dialogues.text: Kick over a rock most of the time something crawls out from under it. (beat) You’re misfortune is I’m the one who kicked over yours. Teddy watching the SCREEN as the ADDRESS SCROLLS ACROSS T BOTTOM OF THE SCREEN. Tactician 1 turning to Teddy.

dialogues.speaker: TACT I
dialogues.text: Isn’t that Agent Pederson’s address? INT. PEDERSON’S HOUSE McCall in the Office. Flash Drive just about done copying files from Pederson’s LAPTOP.  77.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Teddy back at his window. Dull eyes watching the sun set between the buildings. Resignation washing over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralphie standing by the front door with his keys. Young Dudes looking spiffy heading home for the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DUDE 2
dialogues.text: Saturday night. Big mash up at Brian's. You down for that?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DUDE 1
dialogues.text: Like five bucks an hour. Plus tips.

dialogues.speaker: RALPHIE
dialogues.text: Tips?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DUDE 1
dialogues.text: Need a Security dude to watch the liquor. Bring your mace can, Rambo.

dialogues.speaker: RALPHIE
dialogues.text: Fuck you... Good natured LAUGHS as the Dudes head off. Ralphie about to the lock the door when a man steps insid

dialogues.speaker: RALPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're closed... Ralphie looks up into the face of Masters who shows him the Beretta jammed into his belt.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: Don’t be a hero, Chubs.

dialogues.speaker: INTERNET CAFE
dialogues.text: McCall sifting through Pederson’s FILES. Processing what he’s seeing. From his look, something surprising...
Man on a mission now. Swallowed up by Rush Hour foot traf near Penn Station. Dialing the PRE-PAID CELL 34th Street...

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (OS)
dialogues.text: I was hoping you'd call.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Found your money.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Figured you would. You can’t get to it. Or prove it’s mine...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Making assumptions like that is dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Walking through the PARKING GARAGE underneath Oddly calm. His eyes saying... this was fun lasted.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Know the difference between me and you?

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (OS)
dialogues.text: Where should I begin. Teddy slides into his vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: I don’t give a shit. About anything. But you do. And that puts a big bulls-eye on your back. Took me a while to figure it out. (beat) I'll be laser straight with you. Thirty minutes. Boat Basin. Just me and you.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (OS)
dialogues.text: Or? as he crosses his building. while it  79. Teddy pulls a piece of paper from his jacket pocket. Reads...

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Ralph Marquez, Jennifer Gould, Manny Ramirez and the six other Orange vests won’t be going home tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Stopping in the cross walk. Bumped and jostled by COMMUTE

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (OS)
dialogues.text: Violence without a message is a waste of movement. Don’t you think? HOLD on McCall’s face. Audio collapse washing over him. Suddenly the city, its noise, its commotion doesn’t exist Eyes flat and hard. Whatever forms this man’s soul begins spread through his entire body. When his answer comes it’s soft and measured.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Alright. We'll play this your way. Cuts off the call. Thinks for moment. Then looks down at his wristwatch... And starts the Stopwatch ticking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Masters walking Ralphie to the back of the store. Meeting with Buddy and Pederson who have Jenny, Manny and SEVERAL OTHERS. At the SAME TIME...

dialogues.speaker: DOORS TO A MIDTOWN BUS OPEN
dialogues.text: McCall stepping onto the M4 headed downtown. Taking a sea near the MIDDLE EXIT DOORS. Pulling out another PRE-PAID CELL PHONE from the Radio Shack bag. Powering it up.  80. With his other hand punches numbers into HIS cell phone. Forwarding HIS NUMBER to the Pre-paid Phone...

dialogues.speaker: HOME DEPOT
dialogues.text: Sectioned off by a chain link fence. Employees herded int the area by Teddy’s Guys.

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Over the rise WE SEE the dark gleaming grill of a black S roll into a lot. Then another. And another. SIX identical black SUVs, ominous and forboding, pulling onto the asphalt surroundi the premises. PULLING BACK TO SEE... SUVs ringing the perimeter of the structure. INSIDE each TWO RUSSIAN KILLERS.

dialogues.speaker: IN ONE OF THE SUVS
dialogues.text: Russian 7 checks the load in his Glock. Russian 8 on his RADIO with Masters.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN 8
dialogues.text: We're here.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS, (OS)
dialogues.text: Lock down the perimeter. Shoot anyone who looks like him that gets within 20 yards of the place.

dialogues.speaker: HOLDING AREA
dialogues.text: Masters clicks off as Pederson comes back with a handful NYLON wire WRAPS. Tosses them to Ralphie.

dialogues.speaker: PEDERSON
dialogues.text: Behind their backs. Tight.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy leaning against his car. Staring down at his PDA. O THE SCREEN is a GPS screen. McCall’s CELL NUMBER highligh and moving South... Teddy smiles. DIALS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall not on it. CAMERA MOVES under the seat he was in.. McCall’s Cell Phone under it. RINGS SILENTLY..

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Someplace else and moving ANSWERS the Pre-Paid Phone.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (OS)
dialogues.text: Thought you might go ICBM on me. You're making the right decision. For better or worse it was always going to end this way.. McCall keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Yeah well, there are some worsts nobody ever thinks about. Click.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO of the SUVs idling within sight of each other.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE ONE
dialogues.text: RADIO PLAYS Curren$y. Russian 1 behind the wheel bouncin’ it. Not understanding a word. Looks out his window at the SUV across the way. Guys with their feet up on the dash talking to one another. Back to his MUSIC. Turns it up. Adjusts bass. Likes it more. Glances back to the other SUV... No one's in it.  82. Looks around the parking lot. Nothing. Sits up. Turns to his partner.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN 1
dialogues.text: Hey... He’s asleep. Shakes him and the man falls forward. Sharp object protruding through the back of his seat, disappearing into the man. Russian 1 spins quickly towards the back seat. McCall. And that’s the last thing he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Employees on the floor. Hands tie-wrapped behind their backs. Just the SOUND of breathing... Masters rolls the gate shut. Locks it with a padlock. Tak out his phone and starts to dial when... Kool and the Gang begins playing over the store's PA Syst All three snapping into tense mode. Guns coming out... Masters unlocks the cage. Points his weapon at Ralphie.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: Where’s that coming from?

dialogues.speaker: DEPOT AISLE
dialogues.text: Masters and Pederson follow Ralphie as they make their wa through the empty aisles. Guns are drawn. MUSIC drifting from the SPEAKERS above.

dialogues.speaker: KOOL, (VO)
dialogues.text: Oh yes it's Ladies Night and feelin's right...

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICE
dialogues.text: Masters pushes Ralphie into the office as Pederson clears  83. Empty. CD player patched into the PA system. Power on. Masters hits stop and it’s suddenly QUIET again.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: Who else is here?

dialogues.speaker: RALPHIE
dialogues.text: No one. I swear... Pederson grabs Masters arm. Points him to the SECURITY MONITORS. Masters follows his look to CAMERA 16. Middle of the stor A LONE FIGURE moves like a Ghost down a center aisle.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: (into his Radio) He’s in the fucking store!

dialogues.speaker: DOORS TO THE VANS AND SUVS OPEN
dialogues.text: A wave of icy death pour out of the vehicles jacking thei automatic weapons and fan out. Split into GROUPS and head for the various entrances to t store.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS AND PEDERSON
dialogues.text: Throwing Ralphie back into the Holding Area. Tie-wrapping his hands to the gate, padlocking it with Buddy inside.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: We don’t come back... kill ‘em all. Masters goes to call Teddy. Gets no signal. Looks up and follows Pederson’s eyes to the AWNING WINDOWS near the ceiling. Everyone of them covered in TIN FOIL. Blocking the Cell signals in and out...  84.

dialogues.speaker: BOAT BASIN
dialogues.text: Teddy opening the trunk and removing the standard issue Remington 12 gage. Cradles it under his arm and checks hi PDA. McCall's signal closing in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR Russians step inside. Dark. Eyes adjusting. Talks into his RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN
dialogues.text: We're in.

dialogues.speaker: LOADING DOCK
dialogues.text: Large door SWINGS OPEN and RUSSIANS 1, 2 and 3 step insid

dialogues.speaker: GARDEN ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: RUSSIANS 4,5,6 and 7 eyeing the cavernous place.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN 4
dialogues.text: In.

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Russians 8 and 9 close the door behind them. Safeties clicked off...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN 9
dialogues.text: In.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent. Nobody moving. Store quiet and empty. Aisles deserted. Place feels feral and dangerous. That's when THE POWER GOES OUT. ENTIRE STORE plunged into blackness.  85.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE HOLDING AREA
dialogues.text: Masters feels the chill run down his spine. Flips the safety off...

dialogues.speaker: HOME DEPOT
dialogues.text: Dark FIGURES moving into the belly of the store from ever conceivable angle...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIANS 4, 5, 6 AND 7
dialogues.text: Walking slowly. Every SOUND HEIGHTENED.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIANS 8 AND 9
dialogues.text: Kel-Tec Shotguns on their hips. Eyes scanning every shado and space.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIANS 1, 2 AND 3
dialogues.text: Fan out. Each taking a different aisle.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIANS 2 AND 3
dialogues.text: Start down LIGHTING FIXTURES. Broken BULBS litter the mid of the aisle where someone ransacked the shelves...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN 1
dialogues.text: Steps into the PAINT SECTION. SEES... TARPS, PAINT CANS and A HALOGEN WORK LIGHT splayed across floor... Slowly maneuvers around the mess... Stepping ove the Halogen stand WHEN...

dialogues.speaker: THE LAMP BLAZES ON
dialogues.text: Momentarily blinding Russian 1. Turns his head away and finds the spectre of...  86.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Who JAMS his thumb into the Russian’s eye. Then his throa Cutting off his ability to make sound. WHAM! WHAM! Two thumbs into his ribs and diaphragm. Russian 1 doubling over. Making it easier for McCall to snap his neck. Checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: GARDEN AISLE
dialogues.text: Russians 2 and 3 walk with purpose...

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM FIXTURE AISLE
dialogues.text: Russian 4 sweeps his gun across the area...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN 3
dialogues.text: Hardware Section. Mid-aisle. Stops and listens. HEARS a SNAPPING SOUND one aisle over. Quietly pushes aside some boxes on the SHELVING UNIT. Creating space TO SEE INTO THE NEXT AISLE. REVEALING...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Pulling the trigger on the PNEUMATIC NAIL GUN. SINGLE CEM ANCHOR THUDDING into Russian 3’s FOREHEAD. Pulls the spent CO2 cartridge out and pops in another...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIANS 5, 6 AND 7
dialogues.text: Stepping around the corner. SEEING their dead comrade. Faces twists into a masks of rage. Anger blinding them as they stalk down...

dialogues.speaker: THE APPLIANCES AISLE
dialogues.text: In and around the REFRIGERATORS. Past the WASHERS AND DRYERS...  87. Then a HUMMING SOUND. Stop... listen... Eyes following th SOUND to...

dialogues.speaker: THE DISPLAY OF MICROWAVES
dialogues.text: Timers ticking down. Russian 5 leans down and looks inside...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE MICROWAVE WINDOW
dialogues.text: A small propane tank turning slowly on the plate.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: THE WALL EXPLODES INTO FLAMES. A HUGE FIREBALL engulfing three Russians. Bodies catching fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUNDS coming from inside the store waft over Ralphie the other hostages. The SCREAMS frighten them into puddles... Buddy backs away from the gate.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN 8 AND 9
dialogues.text: HEARING the SCREAMS. Following them into...

dialogues.speaker: THE APPLIANCE AISLE
dialogues.text: Where Russians 5,6 and 7 lay smoldering. Flesh burning of their bones. Fear now fills their souls. 8 and 9 exchange looks, turn BOLT... Racing like the wind towards...

dialogues.speaker: THE EMPLOYEE ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Where they STOP DEAD.  88.

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE ENTRANCE DOOR
dialogues.text: Chained and padlocked. From the inside. While on the OTHER SIDE of THE STORE...

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS AND PEDERSON
dialogues.text: Stare grimly at...

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Titanium bicycle chain run through the door handles and locked.

dialogues.speaker: BOAT BASIN
dialogues.text: Teddy waiting just off the rutted path. SEES McCall’s sig has stopped two hundred yards away. Not moving. Dials...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Picks up after the first VIBRATION.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (OS)
dialogues.text: Second thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Just taking care of a few things. Be right with you.

dialogues.speaker: LASER DOTS
dialogues.text: Dance across SHELVING AND MATERIALS. Stepping from the SHADOWS come...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIANS 3, 8 AND 9
dialogues.text: Shoulder to shoulder. Fingers on triggers. Precision movements.  89.

dialogues.speaker: A GLIMPSE OF MCCALL
dialogues.text: Moving quickly across the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: THE RUSSIANS
dialogues.text: Fire their weapons. Shredding everything in its path. Whe it settles... No McCall.

dialogues.speaker: HOLDING AREA
dialogues.text: ECHOING GUNSHOTS shatter the SILENCE. Too much for Buddy. Feeling like a trapped animal so he unlocks the Cage, ste out and re-locks it. WHISPERS into his RADIO...

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: Where the fuck are you guys?

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Like a shadow. Moving towards the final area of the store Oddly calm. Breathing measured. Just the tick... tick... tick of his watch...

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS AND PEDERSON
dialogues.text: In the LUMBER SECTION. Anxious and on edge. Masters click on his RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: Stay with the Hostages.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Pulls BOXES OF ROOFING NAILS AND BRADS off the shelves as walks...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIANS 3, 8 AND 9
dialogues.text: In the PLUMBING SECTION. Every SOUND amplified. 3 hand signals he’s splitting off...  90. MCCALL’S HANDS - SOMEWHERE ELSE Grabbing a GARAGE DOOR REMOTE PACKAGE from a rack of them

dialogues.speaker: AN X-ACTO KNIFE
dialogues.text: Slices open an bag a FERTILIZER. Then ANOTHER...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIANS 8 AND 9
dialogues.text: Move down the BATHROOM FIXTURE SECTION. Turning the corne and... SEEING McCall DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF THEM! EMPTYING THEIR WEAPONS INTO HIS BODY... ONLY TO SEE MCCALL'S IMAGE SHATTER INTO PIECES as the MIRRORED GLASS EXPLODES INTO FRAGMENTS... Understanding too late that... He's behind them.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Running the 6” Drywall Saw through 9’s third and fourth r 8 getting his weapon halfway up when he looks down and SE the Chisel protruding from his chest as he loses feeling his extremities...

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN 3
dialogues.text: Alone. Shuddering in fear three aisles over. Gets to the end of PATIO FURNITURE AISLE. White knuckling his weapon. About to peek around the corner. Never feeling the extension cord until it's around his ne Body jerking like a marionette until... it isn’t. McCall gently drops the body onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS, PEDERSON AND BUDDY
dialogues.text: Coming together from different areas. Converging at the r of the store.  gl. Wound tight. No longer smug. Eyes darting all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: HOME DEPOT
dialogues.text: NINE BODIES strewn about in VARIOUS SECTIONS. The last th men standing in the shadows. Knowing McCall could be anywhere... About to head back into the middle of the store when...

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: SEES the shadow slip into the far rear section of the pla Motions to the others...

dialogues.speaker: GARDEN AREA
dialogues.text: Like a GIANT GREENHOUSE. A large area filled with PLANTS AND TREES and GARDENING EQUIPMENT.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS, PEDERSON AND BUDDY
dialogues.text: Stand at the ONLY ENTRANCE to the area. Hearts beating ha and fast. Knowing McCall is here. Using hand signals MASTERS points Pederson and Buddy down separate aisles.

dialogues.speaker: THE MEN MOVE SLOW
dialogues.text: Every step painful. Bile and dread inching up their throa Finally reaching the...

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL GARDEN AREA
dialogues.text: FOUNTAINS, BIRDBATHS and WIND CHIMES. Against the back wa ALL kinds of PLANTING SUPPLIES.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Against the back wall in the shadows. Just the whites of eyes visible. Standing amongst the garden TOOLS and a row STEEL WHEELBARROWS.  92.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: HEARS that TICKING SOUND. FIRES a SHOT blindly into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Waits. Like a cobra. All three Men stepping into range. CAMERA pans down McCall’s body to his hand. Garage Door remote in it. Finger over the clicker.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS, PEDERSON AND BUDDY
dialogues.text: Taking three steps closer. Then they HEAR it. Eyes fallin on the wheelbarrow as it lowers over the kneeling body of McCall. Exchange confused looks. And at the exact same time realizing they're surrounded b LUMPY bags of FERTILIZER. EMPTY BOXES OF NAILS scattered across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL'S FINGER
dialogues.text: Pushes the Clicker on the Remote as...

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS, PEDERSON AND BUDDY
dialogues.text: Have just enough time to exchange one stupid look before.

dialogues.speaker: BLAMMMMMM
dialogues.text: FERTILIZER BAGS EXPLODING. Nails SCREAM through the air a the speed of sound. High pitched WHINES as the projectile literally nail...

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS, PEDERSON AND BUDDY
dialogues.text: Faces and bodies riddled with the nails. Muscles, tendons and bone cut to pieces. Organs punctured and shredded.  93.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE WHEELBARROW
dialogues.text: Nails THUNK and PIERCE the steel like quills. Stopping inches from McCall's body.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: Barely alive. Bleeding from places he didn’t know could bleed. Stumbling to his feet. SEEING his dead Partners.

dialogues.speaker: SO HE RUNS
dialogues.text: Knees pumping like out-of-sync pistons. RACING towards th BACK OF THE STORE.

dialogues.speaker: HOLDING AREA
dialogues.text: Everyone in the cage frozen in fear. Except Ralphie. He’s furiously working on his tie wraps. Almost gets them loose enough when Masters gun barrel sli through the fence and touches his forehead. Bloody face appearing against the chain link...

dialogues.speaker: HOME DEPOT
dialogues.text: Everything bathed in murky darkness. Nothing moves. The unearthly silent is shattered by...

dialogues.speaker: MCCAAAAAAAAAAALLLLL
dialogues.text: The animalistic cry ECHOES throughout the cavernous store Then Ralphie appears out of the shadows. BARREL OF MASTERS REVOLVER DUCT-TAPED TO HIS TEMPLE... Masters PRESSED UP against Ralphie’s back. DUCT TAPE WEAV

dialogues.speaker: TRIGGER.
dialogues.text: The only thing visible is the COCKED HAMMER... MASTERS (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: HICCUP HE’S DEAD! UNDERSTAND???  94. Ralphie’s eyes squeezed tight. Barely holding it together In his trembling hand is a bolt cutter. Price tag still attached. MASTERS (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Somewhere in the darkness. Eyes studying the impossible. Baretta M9. 4 pounds of pull making it a hair trigger for all intent and purpose. Duct tape masking the exact posit of the trigger finger... Reaches down and grabs the long barrel M16-A out of Russi 4's dead hand. Flips on the LASER SCOPE. Takes a breath.. And steps back into the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS AND RALPHIE
dialogues.text: At the FRONT ENTRANCE. Bicycle Chain the only thing betwe Masters and freedom.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS
dialogues.text: Cut it. Ralphie’s sweat covered hands fumble with the cutters. Masters pressing the barrel harder into the kid’s temple. Ralphie manages to cut one length of the chain. Places th teeth of the cutters over the last piece. Masters eyes DART INTO THE DARKNESS OF THE STORE. No McCa Eerie and way too quiet. Then SEES the FAINT GLOW of RED coming from the far aisle... Looks down... LASER DOT ACROSS THE DUCT TAPE where is hand would be... Masters JERKS RALPHIE around! SPINNING HIM SO THE DOT IS HIS CHEST... MASTERS (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL'S MOUTH
dialogues.text: Right next to Masters ear.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: It look like I'm kidding?

dialogues.speaker: HARD CUT
dialogues.text: Propped up on a shelf all by itself at the end of the ais

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL AND MASTERS
dialogues.text: Masters’ eyes GO WIDE as McCall’s arm snaps around his ne Masters squeezing the trigger... But nothing happens. Masters’ confused. Looks down and SEES THE CARPET KNIFE JAMMED INTO THE HOLLOW OF HIS TRICEP.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Brachial tendon’s severed, Slick. You got nothing from the shoulder down... Box Cutter slices the barrel from Ralphie’s head. Ralphie falling to his knees. McCall twisting the dead arm toward Masters chest.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So let me help you. McCall touches Master’s finger. The Gun FIRES a single MUFFLED SHOT into Master’s heart.

dialogues.speaker: HOME DEPOT -WIDER
dialogues.text: Masters dead before he hits the floor. McCall reaches dow and takes the keys from his belt. Walks over to Ralphie. Helps him to his feet. Shock and awe plastered all over Ralphie’s face. Staring McCall like he was some apparition. McCall drops the keys the Cage and a pair of pliers into Ralphie’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: You should go let them out.  96. Ralphie nods.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you heard. I’m away on a family matter. I’11 be back Monday. A LONG beat. Then Ralphie smiles. INT. TEDDY’S CAR - BOAT BASIN Teddy getting in. Tossing the Shotgun into the back seat when his Cell RINGS. UNKNOWN NUMBER appears on the screen Answers and HEARS...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (OS)
dialogues.text: Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glass and steel modern structure with spiraled columns designed to support nothing except public awe and reveren Teddy coming out of the Bank pocketing AN ENVELOPE. Hits remote. About to climb in when HE SEES... TWO suit-clad MEN on the near corner. Eyes directly on Teddy. Now SEES another TWO MEN on the far corner. Looks across the street... FOUR MORE MEN in SUITS. ALL looking at Teddy.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER, (OS)
dialogues.text: Agent Coleman... Teddy spins. TWO DARK BLUE SUITS, matching haircuts and implacable faces behind him. Agency ID’s in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Special Agent Ward. This is Agent Miller. CIA Internal Affairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller behind the wheel. Ward shotgun. Teddy behind the chicken wire screen in the back.  97. Hands cuffed behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tip of Manhattan. Down Battery Place then taking a DETOUR Crossing Water Street. The sedan jumps down a one lane di road that cuts a swath through a path of dense foliage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy looking around. SEES the CITY being swallowed up by the overgrown TREES...

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Where the fuck we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Road getting smaller, foliage thicker. Rusted out boat trailers litter the shoulder. We're at the abandoned Boat Basin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windshield foliage clears and the Harbour com into VIEW. The car bumps along a bit further then stops a few yards above the water line. Miller and Ward exit the vehicle without a word leaving T alone. After what seems like an eternity the drivers side door o and McCall slides in. McCall doesn’t turn around.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: It was your idea to meet here. Now shifts so he can look directly at Teddy.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s important you understand everything.  98.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: I understand enough.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: I don’t think you do. A long pause. McCall lowers the back windows a few inches

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The place we choose to inhabit, to live our lives, is like it’s own ecosystem. Ecosystems only survive when there’s balance. Otherwise there’s chaos, corruption and injustice. (beat) People like you upset that balance.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about? It was bad guys killing worse guys. You don’t think that exists every fucking place in the world?

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: It does. I’ve seen it. But you’re in my world. And that’s... unacceptable.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Wake up you self-righteous prick. The whole cake’s been divided down to the last crumb. You take what you can get when you can get it. (beat) I didn’t design the system. I simply learned how to play it and win it. (beat) I got seven million dollars in my pocket. It’s yours. Take it. Dole it out to your ecosystem McCall cracks the front windows. Stares out at the water a few moments.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Most people don’t want anything except fairness. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: More and more they feel they can never have it. They see bigger, richer, more corrupt, morally bankrupt, spiritually vacant people get it all. The ones who don’t give a shit... Turns the ignition key halfway. Engine light coming on. Turns around and starts going through Teddy's pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re a bad guy, Teddy. Worse, you're a bad guy who doesn’t give a shit. About anyone. Even yourself. And that makes you more frightening than almost any monster out there. McCall finds the check. Sits back and looks at the amount Whistles. T eddy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Lot of money. Don’t be so smug. In my ecosystem I’1l do four years in some country club prison, get out, move to Dubai. Sell my knowledge and services to some Sheik who likes the idea of having an ex-CIA Agent on his staff. In two years, I'll be a millionaire all over again. McCall takes the check and sticks it on the rearview mirr

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Guess you can take it with you. Slips the car into neutral then opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall steps out and closes the door. The car starting to roll down the embankment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall watches as the car lists down the embankment towar the water. Watches Teddy panic in the back seat, face twisted in impotent fury. Front end of the car hitting the WATER... Teddy pressing face to the small opening on the window.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s this make you? McCall doesn’t bother to answer. The car sinking, hood already submerged. Water rushing through the open windows... Teddy staring through the bac window. Into McCall’s eyes. McCall doesn’t look away. Resignation washing over Teddy. Both men now calm, dispassionate... Water rising above Teddy’s chest, chin, then his face... Finally the car disappearing under water.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Waits a long moment. Turns and walks up the embankment. Crosses the road where ANOTHER CAR WAITS. Walks over to it and gets in the back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan Plummer sits in the back. Miller and Ward silently front. The two exchange looks. Ward puts the car in gear and dri off. EXT. MCCALL’S APARTMENT BUILDING Car pulling up out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan glances up at McCall’s apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I expected more.  101.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: It’s enough. Starts to get out. Stops. Turns back to Susan.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He asked me, doing that, what it made me... Susan thinks. Then looks at her old friend. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Life is a fight. But not everyone’s a fighter. That’s where you come in, Robert. (beat) You're an equalizer. McCall lets it sink in. Gets out without another word and the car drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLEAN UP CREWS still working as EMPLOYEES drift in. Ralph at his place by the front entrance when McCall and the Yo Dudes step through. Looks of surprise at the mess.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DUDE 1
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DUDE 2
dialogues.text: What is this shit?

dialogues.speaker: RALPHIE
dialogues.text: You didn’t hear? Some guys broke in and took a bunch of us hostage. Was a big showdown and a bunch of guys got killed. No one’s telling us much else. Classified or something.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DUDE 2
dialogues.text: Well I ain’t cleanin’ that shit up... McCall starts to follow them into the store.  102.

dialogues.speaker: RALPHIE
dialogues.text: Mr. McCall? McCall turns. Ralphie holds up the PAIR OF PLIERS with th price tag on it.

dialogues.speaker: RALPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mind putting these back for me? The look that passes between them is understood instantly both. This is our secret. And will remain so. McCall smiles. Takes the pliers and heads down the aisle. Back to work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall on his favorite bench. Night air crisp and clean. Like McCall’s soul. There’s a tranquil, untroubled feelin to this man now. Watches the United Nations of faces and families with different eyes. Smiles at the Spanish woman fingering her rosary as she watches her daughter fly by on the Tilt-a-Whirl. Her small son next to her playing Nintendo that probably her a months pay. People trying. That’s what counts. McCall stands and starts for home. Passes the...

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTING BOOTH
dialogues.text: Where that father and son are back. Trying again. Father handing over his last dollar only to get the same result. Takes his kids hand and about to slink off when...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (OS)
dialogues.text: Give the man a sponge guy already. All three heads turn. McCall standing there, hands in his pockets.  103.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guy’s been here every Saturday night for two months. Paid for the sponge ten times over.

dialogues.speaker: BARKER
dialogues.text: Who are you? The boardwalk police? Hit all six targets win the sponge guy. (points to sign) Or can’t you read. And there’s that look again. McCall steps to the counter and drops a dollar bill into barker’s sweaty palm. Turns to the father.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: This one’s on me. Lifts the beat up air rifle... adjusts the aim and... BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! All six targets naile dead center in milliseconds. Barker stands there slack-jawed as McCall grabs the LARGE Sponge Bob and hands it to the Father. Kid’s eyes like saucers. Places the rifle back onto the Barker.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Site’s six degrees off to the left. I'd fix that if I were you. As he walks off...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I’1l be back to check. INT. MCCALL’S APARTMENT - NIGHT McCall at the Kitchen Table. Laptop open. Typing somethin WE HEAR MUSIC drift over the scene. Faint at first. Like was coming through the open window.  104.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: A CRAIGSLIST PAGE. Under the SERVICES subheading. McCall’ fingers writing a POST. A VOICE now SINGING with the MUSIC. A haunting SONG grows LOUDER as WE SEE McCall’s words BEATING OUT ACROSS THE PA

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Stares at the screen. This is who he is now. At peace wit that. SONG getting LOUDER. And as his finger presses SEND WE...

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL DIVE BAR
dialogues.text: Somewhere in Hell’s Kitchen. Dingy and dark and half full That SONG filling the ROOM. On stage a PIANO PLAYER. And Teri. Singing the last notes with all her being. Heartbreakingl magicical... The APPLAUSE more enthusiastic than expected. The LOUDEST is McCall. Against the back wall.

dialogues.speaker: TERI
dialogues.text: Walks off the stage and into the arms of a NICE LOOKING G The look on his face tells us everything we need to know about her life now.  105.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Eyes bright with pride. Drops a twenty on the table and heads for the exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s the same diner fixed up. Maybe it’s a differen one. Doesn’t matter. Because what’s the same is...

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: At a back table. Cup of tea. Book 94 open. “The Invisible Man” by Ralph Ellison. And WE HOLD on this IMAGE for a few beats. Because it fee right and... just. WE HEAR the faint DING of McCall’s CELL. Fishes it out an reads the email.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (OS)
dialogues.text: I saw your ad and I am taking a chance you are real. I am desperate. SQUEALING TIRES OF A 757 HITTING THE RUNWAY...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (OS)
dialogues.text: My family is in danger. The police cannot help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOORS to CUSTOMS sliding open as McCall walks through the shouldering his bag Sign above the doors says: WELCOME TO BRUSSELS EXT. BRUSSEL’S AIRPORT McCall coming out and walking to the curb. Hails a taxi.  106.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (OS)
dialogues.text: I know I am far away but I have no hope and nowhere else to turn. Can you help? As the TAXI pulls curb side McCall slips a pair of SUNGLASSES on and WE GO TO...
